sourcesContent:
import Accordion from 'react-bootstrap/Accordion' import './About.css' function About() { return ( <>

Frequenty Asked Questions

Feel free to contact us below for any questions not answered here.

What does fails-to-deliver mean? Failure to deliver (FTD) refers to a situation where one party in a trading contract (whether it's shares, futures, options, or forward contracts) doesn't deliver on their obligation. Such failures occur when a buyer (the party with a long position) doesn't have enough money to take delivery and pay for the transaction at settlement. - investopedia.com Where is this data from? This data is publically available directly from the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) here. How often is the data updated? The SEC publishes new data bi-monthly. The first half of a given month is available at the end of the month. The second half of a given month is available at about the 15th of the next month. Our servers check for new data nightly. Why is there not more historical data? Cost. We only make money through donations. Each report from the SEC can contain 40k entries, which must be consumed and stored into our database. Hosting and managing our current infrastructure costs $12 a month. Adding more historically data will double or tripple that cost. Why can't I find data for a symbol Not all publically traded companies, funds, stocks, will have shares that failed to be delivered prior to their settlement date. If you don't see the stock symbol you're looking for, that may be that case. Do you offer an API? Yes we do! You can check out our API page.
); } export default About;
